Police can act but they can't rely on videos circulated on Twitter, as they can't verify the authenticity of these videos, it may be fake also, considering the record of Mr.Mevani, I wouldn't trust him either. Let him go to the Police station & provide the source of video

Well in JNU, they didn't wait to verify the authenticity. Police can investigate n that will include verification of this video too.

Mevani is answerable for circulation of video, but in JNU none has been accountable for claiming what they did.
How easy we are at times.

It's sorry state of affairs in our country.Whoever is circulating all these fake videos irrespective of party affiliations should face the full force of the law. For this to happen Govt should bring in Police Reforms & the most important is to abolish the Caste system .

Police reforms in its true sense, more said than done. Apex court has recommended establishing selection commission just like UPSC. Kinds of Modi who use police like errand boys will never enforce such reforms for police.

It's an herculean task to get approval from all the state Govt's as no one would like to surrender the control over police, because these politicians know that most of them will land in jail. We can't blame all the ills in Modi because it's convenient, what about Congress ?

Congress ruled over 60 years & they didn't initiate any Police reforms.The salaries paid to the Police is so less that they can't even meet their family's needs. Salaries needs 2 be raised which will leave the temptation for taking the bribes.
Laanat hai ayesi sarkaar par, jise logo ka dard nhi dikhta..

Genocide which is defined as "intentional action to destroy a people (usually defined as an ethnic, national, racial, or religious group) in whole or in part." What is happening in India is Genocide of the most Lethal Kind
===
Pl read "Nay' as 'May" - 'May I ask" in earlier tweet

End impunity through judicial action
To deter people from committing crimes of genocide, those responsible for such crimes need to be brought to justice. Fighting impunity and establishing a credible expectation that the perpetrators of genocide and related crimes will be held

accountable can effectively contribute to ,http://,prevention.Today, ,, if a State is unwilling or unable to exercise jurisdiction over alleged perpetrators of genocide, the International Criminal Court (ICC) is empowered, within the parameters of its Statute, to investigate and

prosecute those most responsible. The ICC is a permanent tribunal, separate from the United Nations, with its seat in The Hague, Netherlands, to try individuals for genocide, crimes against humanity, and war crimes. It came into being on 1 July 2002, the date its founding treaty,

the Rome Statute, entered into force.
the Secretary-General, in 2004, appointed Juan Mendez as Special Adviser on the Prevention of Genocide, succeeded in 2007 by Francis Deng and in 2012 by Adama Dieng.

The Special Adviser collects information on situations where there may be

a risk of genocide, war crimes, ethnic cleansing and crimes against humanity. Due to the sensitive nature of the mandate, much of his/her work remains outside of the public eye. However, when the Special Adviser assesses that making his/her concerns public will reduce the risk of
